utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Come on, baby. Look at you. Hello. Hi, beautiful. Want to grab your pink rabbit?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look at the rabbit.

utterance.speaker: ALFRED
utterance.content: Oh, my God. Angie!

utterance.speaker: ALFRED
utterance.content: Mi corazon! Oh, God. You look perfect, just perfect!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She's fine. Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ALFRED
utterance.content: Honey, what are you doing? She's here! She's home!

utterance.speaker: ALFRED
utterance.content: What's going on?

utterance.speaker: FBI TECH
utterance.content: Come here, sweetheart.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Here you go, Crawford.

utterance.speaker: FBI TECH
utterance.content: Thank you. Here we go.

utterance.speaker: ALFRED
utterance.content: What did you do?

utterance.speaker: THERESA
utterance.content: I worked fourteen-hour days year after year, killing myself so that we can have a life. And what did you do? Oh, you painted. All you did was paint.

utterance.speaker: ALFRED
utterance.content: That's not true.

utterance.speaker: THERESA
utterance.content: Really? What about that job you said that you were going to get so that I could cut my hours?

utterance.speaker: ALFRED
utterance.content: I was taking care of Angela.

utterance.speaker: THERESA
utterance.content: "Taking care"? You left her there! In front of the TV! Every day! Do you know how many times I woke up to her screams because he was in that room, blasting the music in his ears?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It doesn't give you the right to kidnap your own child.

utterance.speaker: THERESA
utterance.content: How is it kidnapping? She's my daughter.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mrs. Candela, you had your sister climb through that window and take her.

utterance.speaker: THERESA
utterance.content: I gave her permission.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It doesn't matter. You violated your husband's custodial rights.

utterance.speaker: THERESA
utterance.content: "Custodial rights"? He didn't even notice that she was gone! What kind of a father does that to his two year old child?

utterance.speaker: ALFRED
utterance.content: Why would you do this? Why would you put us through that? I mean, for godsake, why not just divorce me?

utterance.speaker: THERESA
utterance.content: Oh, so that you can sue me for alimony? So that you can get half of everything? So that you can get custody of Angela because I'm at work all day and you can "be there for her"? No. I've seen what happens to the guys at work. What happened to Doug Ellers. No way was that gonna happen to me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You were paying the ransom to yourself.

utterance.speaker: THERESA
utterance.content: Once Angela returned, I would file for the papers. There would be nothing left for him to take.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And if Angela was kidnapped when Alfred was taking care of her, then...

utterance.speaker: THERESA
utterance.content: The lawyer said that if I could prove him negligent, I would get custody. I wouldn't have to move out of the apartment that I paid for so that he could live here with my daughter. Do you know how hard it was to adopt her? How much it cost? Ten years! How many paintings have you sold, Alfred? Huh? How many?

utterance.speaker: ALFRED
utterance.content: How could you hate me so much?

utterance.speaker: THERESA
utterance.content: You made it easy.

utterance.speaker: SORENSON
utterance.content: So, how do you think she'll do?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, it depends on how many mothers are on the jury.

utterance.speaker: SORENSON
utterance.content: So, now that it's over... now that I'm back, I was... thinking, maybe we could give it another shot.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And when you leave again?

utterance.speaker: SORENSON
utterance.content: You come with me.

utterance.speaker: SORENSON
utterance.content: Think about it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nice guy. I can see how it wouldn't work, though.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Huh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Handsome, square-jawed, by-the-book.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And that's a bad thing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, he's like the male you. Ying needs Yang, not another Ying. Ying-Yang is harmony, but Ying-Ying is... a name for a panda.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any more wisdom, Obi-Wan?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nope. That's it for today. What say we celebrate by going out for a drink?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I can't. I've got a date.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A date? You date? Who?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That's why it's called "private life." Because it's private. Unlike you, I don't live my life on Page Six.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, you're a mysterious woman, Detective Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe there's a little more Nikki Heat in me than you think.
